intro: Oligoscias madagascariensis, commonly known as the Madagascan olive, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the family Olacaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its fruits are small, fleshy berries that contain seeds, and it is adapted to the tropical and subtropical climates of its native habitat. Oligoscias madagascariensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in Madagascar's flora.
